info.name: Lenticulostriate arteries
info.description: The lenticulostriate arteries are AKA the lateral striate arteries. They are perforating, penetrating, central or ganglionic arteries that branch from the middle cerebral artery as it travels in the lateral fissure. They enter the ventral aspect of the brain to supply deep structures such as the internal capsule, globus pallidus and putament.
